summary: Military service members and veterans may have health issues from their exposure to toxic substances during military service—such as smoke and harmful emissions from open-air burn pits. In 2019, DOD and the VA launched a web-based tool to compile data on individuals' service-related toxic exposures. Staff can use information from the tool to provide health care, process disability claims, and conduct research. But without tracking...
title: Military Health Care: DOD and VA Could Benefit from More Information on Staff Use of Military Toxic Exposure Records
